Issues.Title: BindingParser can't find user-created pipe in html file (Aot Compiler + Ivy)
Issues.Body: # üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? It was problem with new Ivy compiler. ### Description When compile with enableIvy: true and AoT mode, it prints `The pipe {name} cannot be found` error message. According to Ivy status website, It seems Pipe should be work in all the case. It only occurs in Ivy + Aot compile mode. I have 6 projects in production-level and i got same problem in all projects. Ivy + JIT works well. A clear and concise description of the problem... ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Sorry for not providing reproduction link. I don't have enough time now. I can try to create reproduction projects in next week. I create safe pipe in sharedModule ``` @Pipe({ name: 'safe' }) export class SafePipe { constructor(protected _sanitizer: DomSanitizer) { } transform(value: string, type: string): SafeHtml | SafeStyle | SafeScript | SafeUrl | SafeResourceUrl { switch (type) { case 'html': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustHtml(value); case 'style': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustStyle(value); case 'script': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustScript(value); case 'url': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustUrl(value); case 'resourceUrl': return this._sanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustResourceUrl(value); default: throw new Error(`Unable to bypass security for invalid type: ${type}`); } } } ``` and use it in html ``` ``` ## üî• Exception or Error **Exact message (CLI print):** ``` ERROR in : Template parse errors: The pipe 'safe' could not be found (" ][innerHtml]="content | safe:'html'">
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "BindingParser can't find user-created pipe in html file (Aot Compiler + Ivy)" (#27808)

Issues.Title: DEV mode change detection - Show warning if object reference changes in subsequent check
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request ### Relevant Package This feature request is for `@angular/core` ### Description When Angular does change detection, it will re-render the view whenever a property binding changes. There is a slight issue with _what_ Angular considers a "change". If an object reference changes to an object identical to the first one, Angular will update the view with this new object, even if the view ends up being identical to the previous one. This situation is easy for new developers to fall into, as it very easy to write a function like: ``` divClasses() { return { red: this.isRed }; } ``` and then bind it to an `[ngClass]` directive, which will remove and re-apply the `red` class every change detection call, because `divClasses()` returns a new object every time it is run. ```
``` This causes two big problems, the first being inefficient view rendering. Change detection only needs to update the view whenever the component's `isRed` value changes, but it ends up updating the view every single time change detection is run. This would slow down the page and negatively impact the end user's experience. The less obvious problem is the possibility of change detection recursion. If the application has a `MutationObserver` somewhere, watching for DOM changes, the above function will cause it to run every time change detection is ran. If this `MutationObserver` also triggers a change detection check, the page will hang as the `divClasses()` function updates the view, triggering the `MutationObserver`, which triggers change detection again. This might not even directly be the developer's fault, as the `MutationObserver` could be from a 3rd party library. I recently spent a day and a half attempting to debug an application hanging in this way. Funnily enough, the problem was made worse by a 3rd party library which modified `console.log` to run change detection - which caused recursion to happen again. Ultimately, I suspect this scenario might be the cause of issues like https://github.com/valor-software/ngx-bootstrap/issues/3047, https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20450, or https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24614. ### Describe the solution you'd like To be clear, my proposed "fix" does *NOT* involve modifying Angular's change detection to deeply compare object references. Discussion on this bug: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24614 was ultimately tabled because the proposed fix involved deep equality checks, which would be inefficient and very time consuming to check larger objects. Ultimately, the issue here seems to be with functions like my example `divClasses()`, which inadvertently abuse change detection to unnecessarily update the view. If there was some way to alert the developer that a function they've written was possibly faulty, that would probably be the way to go. Currently, Angular displays warnings for change detection when the application is running in dev mode for a similar scenario. If change detection itself causes a property/function to change its output, Angular currently displays a warning about what happened. Could it be possible to display a similar warning for whenever a function returns a different object reference on subsequent change detection calls? A reference check would not be very expensive, and this may end up helping the application developer optimize their program.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DEV mode change detection - Show warning if object reference changes in subsequent check" (#27804)

Issues.Title: NgFor loses focus on reorder to lower index
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description When an element within an `ngFor` is re-ordered and that element contains the currently focused control, focus is not preserved if the re-ordering moves the element to a lower index (i.e. towards the top of the list). However if the element is re-ordered to a higher index, focus on the control is preserved. This happens whether or not a `trackBy` function is used. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mmiwej 1. Select the **Down** radio button. 2. Tab to the **Reorder** button for item 1. 3. Press enter. => Item 1 is moved to position 2 and the **Reorder** button remains focused. 4. Select the **Up** radio button. 5. Repeat steps 2-3. => Item 1 is moved back to position 1 and the **Reorder** button loses focus. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 7.0.6
Node: 8.11.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.0.4
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: test: track payload size for cli-hello-world-ivy
Issues.Body:
Adds size bundle tracking to the integration test `cli-hello-world-ivy` and updates the app itself to reflect the result of using the  `experimentalIvy` flag on the CLI.
The result is similar to:

    npx @angular/cli@next new cli-hello-world-ivy --experimental-ivy --defaults

But replaces the current (cli `7.2.0-rc.0`) `renderComponent` bootstrap with the usual `platformBrowserDynamic` one.
It also keeps what the app did (display a pipe, tests it).

This has been added to track regressions in bundle sizes of a CLI app with Ivy enabled.

Issues.Title: test(ivy): add tests for component factory projectable node corner cases
Issues.Body:
In some cases ivy expects projectable nodes to be passed in a different order
to ViewEngine. Specifically, ivy expects the catch-all ("*") to be at index
0, whereas ViewEngine expects it to be at its position at which it was parsed
in the template.

This commit adds one test that breaks under ivy and others that just describe
more accurately what happens in corner cases.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(ivy): add tests for component factory projectable node corner cases" (#27791)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ngOnChanges only runs for binding updates
Issues.Body:
Updates ivy to trigger onChanges only when bindings update on not when properties are set.

- Currently there are still test failures in a few places, I'm not sure they are related as `core` is passing, if they are not, I'll mark them `fixMeIvy` and move on, because this PR is already pretty large
- SimpleChanges is now stored alongside the directive instance in LView. May changes had to be made to accommodate looking up directive and component instances from LView because of this.
- refactors hooks.ts slightly
- Adds handling for `onChanges` events to `hooks.ts` in `callHooks`.
- Fixes a bug where ngBaseDef creation was not honoring pre-existing ngComponentDef and ngDirectiveDef items
- Updates the Inherit Definition Feature to support inheriting onChanges
- Removes NgOnChangesFeature

**This isn't ready to merge yet**. Just looking for @kara and @mhevery's review.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): restore NG defs after running tests in TestBed
Issues.Body:
`R3TestBed` allows consumers to configure a "testing module", declare components, override various metadata, etc. To do this, it implements its own JIT compilation, where components/directives/modules have Ivy definition fields generated based on testing metadata. It results in tests interfering with each other. One test might override something in a component that another test tries to use normally, causing failures.

In order to resolve this problem, we store current components/directives/modules defs before applying overrides and re-compiling. Once the test is complete, we restore initial defs, so the next tests interact with "clean" components.

**NOTE: this PR is based on another one (PR #27693), so please have a look at this commit only:** https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/6a30d7103ea1840ba7a0e109f1618e6d1ec01d50 .

This PR resolves FW-872.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ng-content tags in re-inserted templates should walk declar‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶ation tree

This PR assures that content projection works if an <ng-content> tag is
placed inside an <ng-template> in one component and that <ng-template>
is inserted into a different component. It fixes a bug where the
projection instruction code would walk up the insertion tree to find
selector data instead of the declaration tree.

This was breaking the Material autocomplete and other overlay-based components.

Issues.Title: project type library doesn't allow deleteOutputPath option
Issues.Body:
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)
```
- [x] bug report 
- [ ] feature request
```

### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Versions

Node.js v10.14.2
npm v6.4.1
Angular CLI v7.0.7
OS: Windows 7


### Repro steps

Adding the `deleteOutputPath` option to the `angular.json` produces an error when the project's `projectType` is `library`. The documentation states that the options apply to either "an app or a library," but this doesn't appear to be the case.


### The log given by the failure
```
Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(deleteOutputPath).
```

### Desired functionality

Desired functionality is that the option be available similarly for both apps and libraries or that the documentation be updated with what options are available per project type.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "project type library doesn't allow deleteOutputPath option" (#13274)

### [`v1.1.2`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​112)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/compare/v1.1.1...v1.1.2)

### [`v1.1.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​111)

-   Check `HUSKY_SKIP_INSTALL` value first before checking if `.git` exists

### [`v1.1.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​110)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/compare/v1.0.1...v1.1.0)

-   Create `.git/hooks` if it doesn't exist

### [`v1.0.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​101)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/compare/v1.0.0...v1.0.1)

-   Various `husky-upgrade` changes ([#​362](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/pull/362), [#​360](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/pull/360), [#​359](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/pull/359))

### [`v1.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​100)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/husky/compare/v0.14.3...v1.0.0)

After a year of pre-releases and a complete rewrite, this marks the first stable release of husky üê∂üéâ.

##### Notable changes

Below you'll find consolidated changes since `0.14.3`. There's no change in code between `1.0.0-rc.15` and `1.0.0`.

-   Hooks

    -   Add `sendemail-validate` hook

-   Config

    -   Move hooks config from `scripts` field to `husky` field
    -   Prefer raw names for hooks (e.g. `pre-commit` rather than `precommit`)
    -   Support `.huskyrc` config

-   Package managers

    -   Support environments where [yarn](https://renovatebot.com/gh/yarnpkg/yarn/) is the only package manager installed
    -   Support [pnpm](https://renovatebot.com/gh/pnpm/pnpm) package manager

-   Environment variables

    -   Add `HUSKY_SKIP_INSTALL` environment variable for skipping git hooks installation
    -   Add `HUSKY_GIT_STDIN` environment variable for `pre-push`, `pre-receive`, `post-receive` and `post-rewrite` to access arguments passed by Git via stdin
    -   Rename `GIT_PARAMS` to `HUSKY_GIT_PARAMS`

-   Messages

    -   Add many more messages in case of errors
    -   Add [please-upgrade-node](https://renovatebot.com/gh/typicode/please-upgrade-node) message if using with unsupported Node version
    -   Make `--no-verify` message more accurate and only show it for hooks that can be skipped

-   Upgrade

    -   Add `husky-upgrade` command to automatically migrate hooks in `package.json`
    -   Add deprecation warning for hooks that are still defined in `scripts`

-   Other
    -   Drop `Node 4` support
    -   Drop integrated `nvm` support (see Node version management in docs)

##### Credits

Huge thanks to all the Contributors and [Patreon Supporters](https://thanks.typicode.com)! üôè

</details>

##### Bug Fixes

-   relax options validation for additional properties ([#​309](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack-contrib/file-loader/issues/309)) ([c74d44e](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack-contrib/file-loader/commit/c74d44e))

Issues.Title: build: update jasmine-spec-reporter to version ^4.0.0
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| jasmine-spec-reporter | devDependencies | major | `^3.2.0` -> `^4.0.0` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter</summary>

### [`v4.2.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​421)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/compare/v4.2.0...v4.2.1)

#### Bugfix

-   Restore compatibility with jasmine < 2.5.0 [#​222](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/pull/222), [#​223](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/pull/223)

### [`v4.2.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​420)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/compare/v4.1.1...v4.2.0)

#### Feature

-   Support reporting errors in afterAll [#​210](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/210), [#​214](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/214)

### [`v4.1.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​411)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/compare/v4.1.0...v4.1.1)

#### Bugfix

-   Correct report from jasmineStarted event [#​185](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/185)

### [`v4.1.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​410)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/compare/v4.0.0...v4.1.0)

#### Feature

-   If any defined spec is not executed, report INCOMPLETE rather than SUCCESS [#​142](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/142), [#​145](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/145)

#### Other

-   Rewrite unit tests by bumping jasmine-core to 2.6.x [#​155](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/155)
-   Use yarn for development [#​98](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/98), [#​138](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/138)
-   Add `greenkeeper-yarn.sh` to automatically updates yarn.lock on greenkeeper PR

### [`v4.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​400)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/compare/v3.3.0...v4.0.0)

-   Use string primitive instead of String wrapper object [#​134](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/134), [#​137](https://renovatebot.com/gh/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter/issues/137)

#### Breaking change

It only impacts TypeScript integrations, `DisplayProcessor` methods signature now use `string` instead of `String`.

Before:

    displaySuite(suite: CustomReporterResult, log: String): String;

Now:

    displaySuite(suite: CustomReporterResult, log: string): string;

</details>

Issues.Body:
<!--
IF YOU DON'T FILL OUT THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION YOUR ISSUE MIGHT BE CLOSED WITHOUT INVESTIGATING
-->
### Bug Report or Feature Request (mark with an `x`)

```

### Versions
node --version = 8.12.0
npm --version = 6.4.1
"@angular/cdk": "^6.4.7",
"@angular/common": "^6.1.7",
"@angular/compiler": "^6.1.7",
"@angular/core": "^6.1.7",


### Repro steps

I have multiple files for unit tests under my project
when I run one file unit test it is working and run through the test without any time-out error message.
But when I run two-three files within one test command it gives me an error.
when I run test again same error comes within different it scope(spec).

### The log given by the failure
Error: Timeout - Async callback was not invoked within 5000ms (set by jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL) 	    at <Jasmine>

### Desired functionality
<!--
I don't understand which part is taking a long time to run test suites.
-->


### Mention any other details that might be useful

I tried to set 


 beforeEach(function() {
        originalTimeout = jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL;
        jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = 10000;
    });

 afterEach(function() {
        jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = originalTimeout;
    });

but it gives me same error of 5000 ms, I am not understanding the behaviour.

**any help will be appreciated**.



here are my two files
```
import {async, ComponentFixture, TestBed} from '@angular/core/testing';
import {ExpertRouteConstants} from "../../../../../_expert-constants/expert-routes";
import {mockEmploymentResponse, mockEmploymentResponse_Single} from "../../../../testing/mock-reponses";
import {BrowserModule, By} from "@angular/platform-browser";
import {SharedService, UtilityLibModule} from 'utility-lib';
import {UserProfileService} from "../../../../services";
import {MockUserProfileService} from "../../../../testing/mock-services";
import {EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent} from "./employment-history-container.component";
import {DebugElement} from "@angular/core";
import {FeatureModule} from "../../../../feature.module";
import {RouterTestingModule} from "@angular/router/testing";

describe('EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent', () => {
    let component: EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent;
    let fixture: ComponentFixture<EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent>;
    let sharedService: SharedService;
    let employmentList;
    let debugElement: DebugElement;
    let htmlElement: HTMLElement;
    let navigateSpy;

    beforeEach(async(() => {
        employmentList = mockEmploymentResponse.payload.employmentDetails;
        TestBed.configureTestingModule({
            imports: [BrowserModule,
                FeatureModule,
                RouterTestingModule,
                UtilityLibModule.forRoot()],
            providers: [SharedService]
        }).overrideComponent(EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent, {
            set: {
                providers: [
                    {provide: UserProfileService, useClass: MockUserProfileService},
                ]
            }
        }).compileComponents().then(() => {
            fixture = TestBed.createComponent(EmploymentHistoryContainerComponent);
            component = fixture.componentInstance;
            component.employmentList = employmentList;
            sharedService = TestBed.get(SharedService);
            navigateSpy = spyOn((<any>component)['_router'], 'navigate');
        })
    }));

    it(`should create`, () => {
        expect(component).toBeTruthy();
    });

    it(`should not display next and previous button if only one record for employment`, () => {
        employmentList = mockEmploymentResponse_Single.payload.employmentDetails;
        component.employmentList = employmentList;
        fixture.detectChanges();
        component.ngOnInit();
        fixture.detectChanges();
        expect(component.employmentList.length).toBe(1);
        expect(component.isMoreThanOneEmploymentList()).toBeFalsy();
        debugElement = fixture.debugElement.query(By.css("button"));
        expect(debugElement).toBeNull();
    });

    it(`should set current employment to the first record from the employment list
     and should set current Index to the 0 when component initiated`, () => {
        fixture.detectChanges();
        expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[0]);
        expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(0);
    });


    it(`should able to display next and previous button if more than one record for employment`, () => {
        fixture.detectChanges();
        expect(component.employmentList.length).toBeGreaterThan(1);
        expect(component.isMoreThanOneEmploymentList()).toBeTruthy();
        debugElement = fixture.debugElement.query(By.css("button"));
        expect(debugElement).toBeDefined();
    });

    it(`should increase the current index and according to that current item gets set`, () => {
        fixture.detectChanges();
        expect(component.employmentList.length).toBeGreaterThan(1);

        expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[0]);
        expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(0);
        component.onNextEmployment();

        fixture.detectChanges();
        expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[1]);
        expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(1);
    });

    it(`should not increase the current index and update current item if
                current Employment is last item within list`, () => {
        const maximumIndex = employmentList.length - 1;
        fixture.detectChanges();
        component.currentEmployment = employmentList[maximumIndex];
        component.currentEmploymentItemIndex = maximumIndex;
        fixture.detectChanges();
        component.onNextEmployment();
        fixture.detectChanges();

        expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[maximumIndex]);
        expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(maximumIndex);
    });


    it(`should decrease employment current index and according to that current item gets set`,
        () => {
            fixture.detectChanges();
            component.currentEmployment = employmentList[1];
            component.currentEmploymentItemIndex = 1;
            fixture.detectChanges();
            component.onPreviousEmployment();
            fixture.detectChanges();
            expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[0]);
            expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(0);

        });

    it(`should decrease employment current index and according to that current item is set 
    only if the current record is not first record from the list`, () => {
        const minimumIndex = 0;
        fixture.detectChanges();
        component.currentEmployment = employmentList[minimumIndex];
        component.currentEmploymentItemIndex = minimumIndex;
        fixture.detectChanges();
        component.onPreviousEmployment();
        expect(component.currentEmployment).toBe(employmentList[minimumIndex]);
        expect(component.currentEmploymentItemIndex).toBe(minimumIndex);

    });

    it(`should redirect add employment page on click of onAddEmployment`, () => {
        component.onAddEmployment();
        expect(navigateSpy).toHaveBeenCalledWith(['/' + ExpertRouteConstants.USER_PROFILE_EMPLOYMENT_NEW_ROUTE]);
    });
});

```


and 


```

Issues.Title: Change global style based on route or component.
Issues.Body:
Hello, I have the following declaration of styles:

```
  "styles": [
              "src/main.scss",
              "src/dashboard-junior",
              "src/dashboard-senior"
            ],
```

I would like to know if there's a way to switch the global style based on a set of routes (preferably) or based on component. Here's my routes file and what I'm trying to achieve:

```
export const routes: Routes = [
    {
        path: '',
        component: HomePageLayout,
        globalStyle: LOAD SPECIFIC CSS/SASS
        children: [
            {
                path: '',
                component: FirstPage,
            },
            {
                 path: 'second',
                 component: SecondPage
            },
        ] 
    },
    {
        path: '',
        component: DashboardJuniorLayout,
        globalStyle: LOAD SPECIFIC CSS/SASS
        children: [
            {
                path: 'firstdashjr',
                component: FirstPageDashBoardJr,
            },
            {
                 path: 'seconddashjr',
                 component: SecondPageDashboardJr
                 
            },
        ] 
    }
]
```

Is it even possible? I've been searching the web for quite some time and so far, nothing..

Issues.Title: build: update webpack to version 4.28.1
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change | References |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| webpack | dependencies | minor | `4.23.1` -> `4.28.1` | [source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v4.28.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.28.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.28.0...v4.28.1)

### Bugfixes

-   fix error in IgnorePlugin when no contextRegExp is passed

### [`v4.28.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.28.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.27.1...v4.28.0)

### Features

-   IgnorePlugin: `checkResource` has an additional `context` argument

### Bugfixes

-   Injection of node.js globals has been disabled for `.mjs` files as it's crashing

### [`v4.27.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.27.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.27.0...v4.27.1)

### Bugfixes

-   v4.27.0 accidentially introduced a breaking change. This reverts the change and restores the original behavior for `splitChunks` `enforce`.

### [`v4.27.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.27.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.26.1...v4.27.0)

### Features

-   When using functions as plugins they are now also called with the compiler as parameter
    -   This make it possible to use arrow functions as plugins
-   splitChunks.maxSize now emits a warning when minSize > maxSize
-   Loaders have now access to a `getResolve` method to create their own resolver function with custom options

### Bugfixes

-   splitChunks.cacheGroups.xxx.enforce now behaves as documented and enforce chunk creation
-   splitChunks.cacheGroups.xxx.enforce now no longer deletes minSize for maxSize
-   fixes a bug where splitChunks cause cacheGroups to be incorrectly merged when using the same name
    -   now conditions are considered per cacheGroup
    -   the correct cache group comment is displayed in stats
-   fixes a bug which causes providedExports not to be updated on rebuilds when using `export * from`

### [`v4.26.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.26.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.26.0...v4.26.1)

### Bugfixes

-   fix a bug where splitChunks.maxSize causes a hanging build
-   fix a bug where splitChunks.maxSize crashes when minSize > maxSize
-   fix a edgecase where splitChunks.maxSize can cause chunks bigger than minSize
-   remove unnecessary code from global builtin

### [`v4.26.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.26.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.25.1...v4.26.0)

### Features

-   Switch from uglify-es to terser as default minimizer

Note: While they are officially backward-compatible, it can still happen that a new bugs occurs with terser, which break your production builds. Make sure to validate your production builds after upgrading to this version. (Note that it's always a good idea to test your output assets before deploying.)

If you want to report bugs to terser (<https://github.com/terser-js/terser>), please provide a minimal repro case with minimized and **non-minimized** code. You can configure webpack to generate non-minimized code in production mode by setting `optimization.minimize: false`. When reporting a bug to terser, best report a repro case which doesn't require running webpack and is reproducible with only the terser command line.

See [`optimization.minimizers`](https://webpack.js.org/configuration/optimization/#optimization-minimizer) configuration option to switch back to uglify-es or provide additional minimize options for terser.

### [`v4.25.1`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.25.1)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.25.0...v4.25.1)

### Bugfixes

-   fix replacement of compile-time constant expression when expression is a wrapped expression (string prefix and/or suffix).

### [`v4.25.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.25.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.24.0...v4.25.0)

### Features

-   add `format` option to `DllPlugin` to allow generating formated manifest json
-   add flags to `ProgressPlugin` to add and remove information
    -   entrypoint counter was added, but disabled by default to avoid breaking change

### Bugfixes

-   fix code generation for context dependencies when replacing compile-time constant expressions
-   disable the effect of the ProvidePlugin for `.mjs`

### [`v4.24.0`](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/releases/v4.24.0)

[Compare Source](https://renovatebot.com/gh/webpack/webpack/compare/v4.23.1...v4.24.0)

### Features

-   allow to pass no dependencies to DefinePlugin runtime value
    -   `DefinePlugin.runtimeValue(() => {...}, true)` is always evaluated
-   add `module` argument to `DefinePlugin.runtimeValue`

### Bugfixes

-   update webassemblyjs dependency
-   fix bug when using entry names that look like numbers with HMR

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): generate coverage for libs in their own folder
Issues.Body:
BEFORE:
`ng test foo --code-coverage` would generate the code coverage in the `coverage` folder and would overwrite the code coverage folder of the main app.

AFTER:
Now the code coverage resides in its own folder (`coverage/foo`).

This mimic the behaviour of the `ng build` command and adds more consistency.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): generate coverage for libs in their own folder" (#13249)

Issues.Title: getRtlScrollAxisType detects incorrect RtlScrollAxisType for safari
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior? In safari, `getRtlScrollAxisType() === RtlScrollAxisType.NEGATED` #### What is the current behavior? `getRtlScrollAxisType()` returns `RtlScrollAxisType.INVERTED` #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? - Angular/Angular Material 7.0.4 - macOS 10.13.6 - Safari version 12.0.2 (13606.3.4.1.4) #### Is there anything else we should know? Problem unlikely to do with safari and os. Other libraries detected it correctly using feature detection technique
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "getRtlScrollAxisType detects incorrect RtlScrollAxisType for safari" (#14609)

Issues.Title: fix(progress-bar): set appropriate aria-busy based on the current mode
Issues.Body: Based on [the following example of an accessible progress bar](https://dequeuniversity.com/library/aria/custom-controls/sf-progress-bar-unbounded), these changes set the correct `aria-busy` value based on mode of the progress bar.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(progress-bar): set appropriate aria-busy based on the current mode" (#14608)

Issues.Title: fix(select): don't shift arrow if there is no label
Issues.Body:
Currently we move the arrow for a `mat-select` inside a form field up if it has a value, in order to align it in the middle of the field, however doing so when there is no label makes it look off-center. This is visible when using the `standard` appearance inside a `mat-paginator`. These changes only shift the arrow if there's a label.

Fixes #13907.

For reference, this is what it looks like at the moment:
![angular_material_-_google_chrome_2018-12-21_21-02-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/50362462-219a2a80-0568-11e9-91f5-d3cadad76c5f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): don't shift arrow if there is no label" (#14607)

Issues.Title: Drag and drop previews do not show the correct value within a select element
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
While an item containing a select element is being dragged, the preview should display the correct selected value within the select element.

#### What is the current behavior?
While an item containing a select element is being dragged, the preview displays the select element, with the value set to the default value. Once the item has been dropped, the value is then displayed correctly.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
In the following StackBlitz example, change one of the select options to anything other than the default 'Please select an extra...' option. Now when you drag the amended item, note how the select element has been reset to 'Please select an extra...' within the preview. Once the element has been dropped, the value is displayed correctly.

https://angular-cdqlup.stackblitz.io


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drag and drop previews do not show the correct value within a select element" (#14591)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): defers close panel listeners to the next tick (#13‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
Deferring panel-closing listeners allows events to propagate thus preventing immediate closure.
For example, if openPanel is called from a button click event listener, the panel will close
immediately.

Fixes #13547
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(autocomplete): defers close panel listeners to the next tick (#13‚Ä¶" (#14606)

Issues.Title: [mat-stepper] Consider detaching inactive steps from Angular change detection
Issues.Body:
Angular's [ChangeDetectorRef](https://angular.io/api/core/ChangeDetectorRef) provides [detach](https://angular.io/api/core/ChangeDetectorRef#detach) and [reattach](https://angular.io/api/core/ChangeDetectorRef#reattach) methods that allow to temporarily disable change detection on the given component.

Have you considered using it in [mat-stepper](https://material.angular.io/components/stepper/overview)? In case two or more steps use shared data, there is no point wasting CPU cycles for updating components on inactive steps. _(Of course, these components will need to be updated eventually, when the user visits the corresponding steps, but it is still much better than updating them all the time.)_

I have prepared a demo project:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/mat-stepper-change-detection-demo

Scenario:
1. focus the number field
2. hold the Up Arrow key for a few seconds
3. note the lags and high CPU usage while the Up Arrow key is held

It happens because the contents of the second step keep updating on every change in the number field. _(On the demo page the issue is exacerbated by the fact that initialization of every new Quill component takes significant amount of time)._

4. press the [Detach] button to detach the second step from change detection
5. note that the number field now works smootly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-stepper] Consider detaching inactive steps from Angular change detection" (#14605)

Issues.Title: TemplatePortal class signature: possible typo
Issues.Body:
It seems like the `TemplatePortal` class signature

https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/fe7f95ec10acd9e660f7037be8d006c9e264a57b/src/cdk/portal/portal.ts#L119 

should actually be 

```ts
    export class TemplatePortal<C = any> extends Portal<EmbeddedViewRef<C>> {
```

and

https://github.com/angular/material2/blob/fe7f95ec10acd9e660f7037be8d006c9e264a57b/src/cdk/portal/portal.ts#L145

should be

```ts
    attach(host: PortalOutlet, context: C | undefined = this.context): EmbeddedViewRef<C> {
```

The generic parameter for `Portal` is for the type that the `attach(host: PortalOutlet): T` method returns. That returns what `PortalOutlet` 's `attach(portal: Portal<any>): any;` returns. _Note: This could be `attach<T>(portal: Portal<T>): T;` couldn't it_ If you look at the implementation of `PortalOutlet`, `BasePortalOutlet`, it's overload for `attach()` when passing a `TemplatePortal` is `attach<T>(portal: TemplatePortal<T>): EmbeddedViewRef<T>;` not `attach<T>(portal: TemplatePortal<T>): T;` like you'd expect based on the `TemplatePortal` class signature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TemplatePortal class signature: possible typo" (#14584)

Issues.Title: Branch manager should check diff instead of patch
Issues.Body:
Consider you have multiple commits within a PR, first commits adds a file, second commit renames the file.

The patch for that change will not apply with `git apply` because the patches are not run sequentially and therefore `git apply` will throw when it tries renaming the file in the second commit.

e.g. 

```patch
From 5fa1e23cb00a04c9b084f8634c7e7cea9b413d8e Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Paul Gschwendtner <paulgschwendtner@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 19 Dec 2018 20:54:09 +0100
Subject: [PATCH] My second PR commit

---
 srcs/my-file.txt => my-new-name-file.txt | 0
 1 file changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)
 rename srcs/my-file.txt => my-new-name-file.txt (100%)

diff --git a/srcs/my-file.txt b/my-new-name-file.txt
similarity index 100%
rename from srcs/my-file.txt
rename to my-new-name-file.txt
-- 
2.19.1.windows.1

From aaa9e380164af93d92982aca740bb56696ae2879 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Paul Gschwendtner <paulgschwendtner@gmail.com>
Date: Wed, 19 Dec 2018 20:53:54 +0100
Subject: [PATCH] First PR commit

---
 srcs/my-file.txt | 0
 1 file changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)
 create mode 100644 srcs/my-file.txt

diff --git a/srcs/my-file.txt b/srcs/my-file.txt
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..e69de29
-- 
2.19.1.windows.1
```

We should rather just check the PR's `.diff` file that just reflects the difference and nothing more. This also makes sure that subsequent commits in a PR can become green if previous commits didn't apply properly. As an example: see #14565
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Branch manager should check diff instead of patch" (#14582)

Issues.Title: build: update branch manager config
Issues.Body:
Currently `7.1.x` is not really in sync with the build tooling from `master`. This was because some PRs couldn't be cherry-picked cleanly into the `7.1.x` branch, and were just left out.

Now that we have `7.2.0`, we should use a new patch branch and base it on `master`, so that the branch-manager will not mark a lot of PRs as failing.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update branch manager config" (#14580)
